entry.title: Mary Arthur McElroy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mary Arthur McElroy (pictured) was never given formal recognition as First Lady of the United States out of respect for Nell Arthur, the deceased wife of then-president Chester A. Arthur?

entry.title: Old-Fashioned Cupcake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that actor Tatsunari Kimura ate pancakes and drank coffee while talking for eight hours during the filming of the television drama Old-Fashioned Cupcake?

entry.title: Wang Su-bok (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that popular Korean folk singer Wang Su-bok was given birthday gifts by both Kim Il-sung and Kim Jong-il?

entry.title: God Giving Birth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the painting God Giving Birth was inspired by Monica Sjöö's inner visions while giving birth?

entry.title: King Edgar of England (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that King Edgar of England wanted to marry Wufhild, but she rejected him to become a nun instead?

entry.title: Most Likely You Go Your Way and I'll Go Mine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 2007, the 1966 track "Most Likely You Go Your Way and I'll Go Mine" was the first of Bob Dylan's songs to be officially remixed?

entry.title: Iszac Henig (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that trans man Iszac Henig alternated wins against trans woman Lia Thomas on the way to the 2022 NCAA Division I Women's Swimming Championship?

entry.title: Commission on Training Camp Activities (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Commission on Training Camp Activities allegedly used sexual denial to make American World War I soldiers fight harder?
